JUnit

Class CoreTest

extends java.lang.Object

      • CoreTest

        public CoreTest(java.lang.String b,
        int[] p,

        CoreTest constructor with parameter setting
        Parameters:
        b - String content of buffer
        p - Array int with start and end position of selection
        c - String content of clipboard

    • Method Detail

      • parameters

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> parameters()
        Test cases
        Returns:
        Collection of core test cases (with buffer, positions, clipboard)

      • testInsert

        public void testInsert()
        tests function to insert text into buffer
        precondition of a test case
        start position <= end position, end position <= buffer length (implies that start position <= buffer length too), start position and end position >= 0
        postcondition of a test case
        buffer = buffer + text in parameters, start and end positions = old start position + insert length, clipboard is the same

      • testSelect

        public void testSelect()
        tests function to select text in buffer
        postcondition of a test case
        start position <= end position, end position <= buffer length (implies that start position <= buffer length too), start position and end position >= 0, start and end position are defined in Selection of Core, buffer and clipboard are still the same

      • testCopy

        public void testCopy()
        tests function to copy text from buffer into clipboard
        precondition of a test case
        start position <= end position, end position <= buffer length (implies that start position <= buffer length too), start position and end position >= 0
        postcondition of a test case
        buffer and selection haven't changed, text between start & end in clipboard

      • testCut

        public void testCut()
        tests function to cut text from buffer into clipboard
        precondition of a test case
        start position <= end position, end position <= buffer length (implies that start position <= buffer length too), start position and end position >= 0
        postcondition of a test case
        text between start & end not in buffer anymore, text between start & end in clipboard, end position is set to the old start position and start position doesn't change

      • testPaste

        public void testPaste()
        tests function to paste text from clipboard into buffer
        precondition of a test case
        start position <= end position, end position <= buffer length (implies that start position <= buffer length too), start position and end position >= 0
        postcondition of a test case
        text between start & end replaced by content in clipboard, start & end position reset to old start + clipboard size, clipboard doesn't change
